title: Tyler, The Creator says Eminem picks the ‘worst beats ever’
text:
Tyler the Creator slams Eminem on rap beats

Tyler, The Creator isn’t too impressed with Eminem’s choice of beats, claiming they are the ‘worst ever’. Ouch.

The rapper, real name Tyler Gregory Okonma, revealed what he thought about Eminem’s music on Rick Rubin’s Broken Record podcast, and it’s safe to say he didn’t mince his words…

When asked whether there were any rappers who he listened to specifically for the lyrics, he chose Eminem, but slammed the beats he raps over.

He explained: ‘Some people who hear a smooth beat like, “I’ma going f**king yell on it! I’mma do this”. They’re more thinking of saying cool s**t rather than making a good song…

‘Eminem picked some of the worst beats ever. His energy and witty lines is what made the songs cool.’

Eminem might have some things to say (Picture: Rex Features)

It’s not the first time Eminem and Tyler haven’t seen eye to eye – he also came under fire on Eminem’s song Fall from his Kamikaze album.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Eminem, real name Marshall Mathers III, received backlash from fans after using a homophobic slur against Tyler in his lyrics.

Tyler, however, told The Guardian that he wasn’t affected by the diss, explaining: ‘Did you ever hear me publicly say anything about that?

‘Because I knew what the intent was. He felt pressured because people got offended for me. Don’t get offended for me.

‘We were playing Grand Theft Auto when we heard that. We rewound it and were like, “Oh.” And then kept playing.’

Eminem later admitted he regretted using the slur, explaining: ‘In my quest to hurt him, I realise that I was hurting a lot of other people by saying it.’

Tyler has since returned to the UK for the first time since he was banned from the country in 2015, and is currently in the middle of his international Igor tour.

description: Tyler, The Creator has slammed Eminem's choice of beats, but praised his lyrical ability despite the rapper using a homophobic slur against him.
